ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'week' (from Old English wicu) and 'day' (from Old English dæg). Used to differentiate the standard working days from the weekend.
SINCE: c. 13th Century (in the context of distinguishing work days from the Sabbath/weekend)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any day of the week except Saturday and Sunday, typically referring to Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, or Friday.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一周中除周六和周日以外的任何一天；工作日（通常指周一至周五）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The traffic is always much lighter on the weekend than it is during the weekday.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 周末的交通总是比工作日的时候轻得多。

REGISTER: General use, particularly when discussing schedules and routine.
